results.title: Along the way
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film exploring the realistic image of a human figure running through abstract and surrealistic manipulations. Film without dialogue.

results.title: Allegro non troppo
results.brief_description: A parody of the Disney film “Fantasia”, “Allegro non troppo” features the highly creative work of talented Italian animator Bruno Bozzetto. It transcends the genre of parody to become a beautiful film in its own right. There are six animated sequences set to classical music, linked together by live-action scenes subtitled in English. The all-female orchestra is composed of old women and directed by a mad conductor (Maurizio Nichetti). This version features ten minutes of previously unreleased music and includes the music of Debussy, Dvorak, Ravel, Sibelius, Vivaldi and Stravinsky.

results.title: Aluminium in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: This film tells of the mining of bauxite deposits at Weipa in the far north of Australia - the York Peninsula. The product of this vast mining venture is then transported to Tasmania where it is processed into ingots at the Bell Bay Refinery. From ingots through the rolling mills it is processed into suitable form for the making of a variety of finished products for industry, the home and for commercial buildings. The enormous possibilities of the use of this light, versatile twentieth century metal are shown.

results.title: Alphonse Mucha
results.brief_description: The Mucha Foundation presents this detailed documentary on the life and work of Alphonse Mucha, the Czech-born artist credited with influencing the direction of French Art Nouveau at the turn of the nineteenth century. Born in Ivancice, Moravia, in 1860, Mucha was blessed with a natural artistic talent that saw him committing to a career as a painter of historical and religious subjects very early in his life. Assisted by the financial support of a wealthy patron, Mucha was able to enhance his natural talent with formal training at the Academy in Munich, and after graduation, a move to Paris in 1887. A crucial turning point in his life arrived in 1890 when Mucha’s patron withdrew his financial assistance, and he was forced to earn his own living by sending pictures to magazines and creating illustrations for books. After four years, he became an established illustrator, but it was only at after he designed a poster to advertise the Sarah Bernhardt play, “Gismonda”, did he achieve the fame he craved. This prolific and focused artist began to churn out designs for an astonishing array of works, including posters, jewelry, paintings, and even the architecture and decoration of the Pavilion of Man for the Paris World Fair of 1900. Mucha’s one true desire, however, was to paint the Slav Epic - a grand-scale depiction of his native country’s strong national consciousness and struggle for independence - and with the financial support of millionaire Charles Crane, he was finally able to realise this vision in 1910. By the time of his death in 1939, Mucha had donated the entire Slav Epic exhibition to Prague, and helped to design almost everything for the newly formed Czech Republic, including medals, stamps and bank notes.

results.title: Almost famous [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Cameron Crowe, Ian Bryce and Vinyl Films
results.brief_description: Director Cameron Crowe’s experience as a teenage journalist for “Rolling Stone” magazine was the inspiration for this academy award winning film. Set in the 1970s, William Miller (Patrick Fugit) lives with his loving but over-protective mother Elaine (Frances McDormand), rebelling against her by writing music reviews for an underground newspaper. He is discovered by Lester Bangs (Philip Seymour Hoffman), editor of a controversial rock magazine, and is hired to review a Black Sabbath concert. While he is unable to review the band, he interviews opening act ‘Stillwater’, and the resulting article gains the attention of “Rolling Stone” magazine. Despite his mother’s distrust in the world of rock music, William joins Stillwater on tour, becomes friends with the band, falls for leader of the ‘Band-aids’, Penny Lane (Kate Hudson), and discovers what really goes on behind the scenes in the rock and roll world. Cast includes Billy Crudup, Jason Lee, Anna Paquin, Fairuza Balk, Noah Taylor, Bijou Phillips and Zooey Deschanel. (Awards: Academy Awards, Cameron Crowe for Best Screenplay).

results.title: All the Rivers Run II
results.brief_description: This is a stunning sequel to the internationally acclaimed series of the same name. The once thriving riverboat trade has been hit hard by bad times with the shearers strike and the arrival of new roads and railways. Brenton, Delie and their three children are desperately battling the odds to simply earn a living on the river. Into their lives walks a mysterious stranger who is immediately drawn to Delie. Based on the novel by Nancy Cato. R Rated: PG

results.title: All the way up there
results.creator_credit: Gaylene Preston, Warrick Attewell and Valhalla Film Productions
results.brief_description: Bruce Burgess, a 24 year-old cerebral palsy victim, realises an impossible dream - to climb a mountain. He manages to achieve this with the help of Graeme Dingle, one of New Zealand’s best known mountaineers. Emphasises the need for individual self-fulfilment despite physical or other limitations Narrated by David Yerix.

results.title: All the rivers run [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ian Crawford, Hector Crawford and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: A story of love between a man, a woman and the river which bound them together. After being shipwrecked a young woman accepts her uncle’s offer of the chance to begin a new life at Echuca where she meets her future husband. Together, they start a business carrying cargo on the Murray River. An adventurous story set in the early days of white settlement on the Murray River. Based on the novel by Nancy Cato.

results.title: All the right stuff
results.creator_credit: Connie Littlefield, Mike Mahoney and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Join Brendan as he spends $200 of his disposable birthday cash on clothes, music and entertainment. He is just one of a large group that is an image marketers dream; young, impressionable, earning money from a low paying service job with money to burn. Whilst working his way in and out of well known brand name shops, he, as well as other teenagers, shop owners and adults, discuss the impact of advertising on them, how it influences their sense of being and consumer purchasing. They also share their thoughts for their future.

results.title: All that jazz starring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen
results.brief_description: Documentary film featuring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen performing live on stage interspersed with personal anecdotes by Kenny Ball about his life on the road as a jazz musician. The music is great, from dixieland to gospel, and includes the memorable “Midnight in Moscow” along with “When the Saints go marching in”, “We shall not be moved” and many other jazz favourites. No credits available.
